info.title: PegasusAstro
info.description:
## Getting Started
___
This document explains how to successfully make Rest API calls to PegasusAstro Unity Server. The document has two parts. The first part introduces some basic concepts, and the second one is the actual Interactive API Documentation Schema. We call it Interactive because you can use this page to make actual http calls, check `Try it out`concept.

```
For this point and forward, we assume we have at least one Pegasus Astro device attached to our computer. So, weâ€™ll pick up the well-known Ultimate PowerBox v2 (UPBv2).
```

## Concepts

### DriverUniqueKey 
This is a unique key (GUID type) for every device attached to it. Server attaches this key during the first time of device connection. In subsequent connection of the device server attaches the Unique Key already stored in database.

### Try it out
Every device has a group of action. Every action is expandable by clicking on it. Expanding an action, click on `Try it out`, put the DriverUniqueKey of your device and hit execute. The server will response to your request.
____

## Flow
1. Start Server
2. Get DriverUniqueKey from Connected Devices list
3. Start Driver with DriverUniqueKey
4. Make calls to driver passing the DrvierUniqueKey


### Server Start/Stop
Starting the server is required in order to detect the plugged device into your computer. So, this is the initial http call you must perform. Expand the #Server group and use the `Try it out` concept. Calling stop the server dettaches all the devices and releases any communication channel with them.


### Connected Devices
 Retrieving conneted device list calling the according request from #Server group.

### Driver Start/Stop
Any call requires to first start the driver by using the DriverUniqueKey you have already selected from the connected device list.

### Request to Driver
Now you are ready to make calls to the driver, do not forget to pass the DriverUniqueKey in every request.

___

# Request Examples

Choose your favorite http client. all the response is in Json format.

## Start server

### .net C#

```
    var httpRequestMessage = new HttpRequestMessage();
    httpRequestMessage.Method = HttpMethod.Put;
    httpRequestMessage.RequestUri = new Uri($"http://localhost:32000/Server/Start");
    var response = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseContentRead);
```

## Get connected Devices

### .net C#
```
    var httpRequestMessage = new HttpRequestMessage();
    httpRequestMessage.Method = HttpMethod.Get;
    httpRequestMessage.RequestUri = new Uri($"http://localhost:32000/Server/DeviceManager/Connected");
    var response = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseContentRead);
```

## Start Driver

### .net C#
```
    var httpRequestMessage = new HttpRequestMessage();
    httpRequestMessage.Method = HttpMethod.Options;
    httpRequestMessage.RequestUri = new Uri($"http://localhost:32000/Driver/UPBv2/Start?DriverUniqueKey=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000");
    var response = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseContentRead);
```


## Power on the second power port of UPBv2 

### .net C#
```
    var httpRequestMessage = new HttpRequestMessage();
    httpRequestMessage.Method = HttpMethod.Put;
    httpRequestMessage.RequestUri = new Uri($"http://localhost:32000/Driver/UPBv2/Power/2/On?DriverUniqueKey=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000");
    var response = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseContentRead);
```

post.summary: Enable Auto dew based on a profile schema.
post.description:
Profiles:

0.Disable Auto Dew 

1.Enable all ports 1~3

2.Enable only port 1

3.Enable only port 2

4.Enable only port 3

5.Enable ports 1 and 2

6.Enable ports 1 and 3

7.Enable ports 2 and 3
